thread.title: EastEnders' Bex releases heartbreaking song about Shakil split in full
thread.title_full: EastEnders' Bex releases heartbreaking song about Shakil split in full

author: Jennifer Crothers
title: EastEnders' Bex releases heartbreaking song about Shakil split in full
text:
EastEnders' Bex releases heartbreaking song about Shakil split in full Actress Jasmine Armfield has a hit on her hands with Boxed Up Broken Heart Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Eastenders' Bex releases emotional song to Shakil Share this video Get soaps   Thank you for subscribing!   
Bex from EastEnders isn't just a popstar in Walford - she's now got a hit in real life too. 
Actress Jasmine Armfield wowed viewers with her song Boxed Up Broken Heart on the show on Thursday - a ballad for her ex boyfriend Shakil. 
And now, the heartbreaking song about their split has been made available in full online. 
“Bex has written this song because she’s got so much going on in her life,” says Jasmine. “She’s got all these different feelings and all these different emotions. Actress Jasmine Armfield helped write the song with singer/songwriter Gwyneth Herbert (Photo: BBC/Youtube) Boxed Up Broken Heart is available in full online (Photo: BBC/Youtube) Bex and her guitar in Albert Square (Photo: BBC) 
“She can’t quite put it all into words so I think her way to get round that its to just put it all into a song and to sing about it instead. 
“Each lyric has something behind it to hopefully help Bex and to get through to Shakil, there’s definitely a message in there for him. 
Jasmine teamed up with a songwriter to help create the specially-written song for EastEnders , which channels Bex’s emotions after Louise Mitchell shared intimate snaps she and Shakil sent each other. 
“I was told they wanted Bex to record an original song, and they were getting a singer/songwriter to write it for her,” explains Jasmine. 
“I had a meeting with Gwyneth Herbert, the writer, and we had a huge chat about everything, about Bex’s feelings, her character. Shakil and Bex, in happier times Bex in EastEnders when she didn't have many cares in the world (Photo: BBC) Read More Eastenders bosses fear Danny Dyer could QUIT show after taking break 
“I had a lot of input. I worked really closely with Gwyneth. I was so happy with it thought. I was like ‘this is perfect for Bex’. Everything that Bex is feeling has been put into a song. It was great!” 
While Bex has found an outlet for her emotions in song, Jasmine admitted it’s going to be tough for her character in the foreseeable future. 
“I think it’s going to be quite hard for Bex in the next few months. She’s having quite a hard time at school and I think she’d very confused. She doesn’t want to hurt anyone; she’s genuinely such a kind-hearted girl. 
“I thinks sometimes Bex needs to speak up instead of keeping it bottled up. She needs to talk to people and let them know how she’s feeling.” 
EastEnders airs on Monday, Tuesday, Thursday and Fridays on BBC One Like us on Facebook
